questions.question: As the angle of the incline ($\theta$) increases, what happens to the normal force ($F_N$)?
questions.explanation: $F_N = mg \cos \theta$. As $\theta$ increases, $\cos \theta$ decreases, so normal force decreases.

questions.question: What is the acceleration of an object sliding down a frictionless incline?
questions.explanation: Component of gravity down incline = $mg \sin \theta$, so $a = g \sin \theta$.

questions.question: What is the 'angle of repose' (the maximum angle before a block slips)?
questions.explanation: At maximum angle before slipping: $mg \sin \theta = \mu_s mg \cos \theta$ ⇒ $\tan \theta = \mu_s$.

questions.question: A 15 kg crate sits on a frictionless $25^\circ$ ramp. What is the minimum force applied parallel to the incline required to keep the crate from sliding down? (Use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
A wooden block is placed on a plank. You slowly lift one end of the plank. If the coefficient of static friction is $\mu_s = 0.45$, at what minimum angle will the block finally begin to slip?
A car is parked on a very steep $20^\circ$ icy driveway. What is the minimum coefficient of static friction ($\mu_s$) required to keep the car from sliding down the hill?

A 10 kg box is on a $60^\circ$ slope with $\mu_s = 0.1$. Since the slope is so steep, friction alone isn't enough. How much force must a person apply perpendicularly (pressing into the ramp) to keep the box from sliding? (Use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: $mg \sin 60^\circ = 84.9\text{ N}$, $\mu_s mg \cos 60^\circ = 4.9\text{ N}$. Need $84.9 = 0.1(49 + F)$ ⇒ $F = 800\text{ N}$.

questions.question: A 10 kg block (Block A) sits on a frictionless $30^\circ$ incline. It is connected by a rope over a pulley to a hanging mass (Block B). What is the minimum mass Block B must have to keep Block A from sliding down the ramp? (Use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
If a block is being pulled up a ramp, in which direction does the kinetic friction act?
options: Directly downward toward the center of the Earth.
questions.explanation: Kinetic friction always opposes the direction of motion. Since the block is moving up the ramp, friction acts down the ramp.

questions.question: A 25 kg crate is on a $20^\circ$ ramp ($\mu_k = 0.2$). What is the minimum tension required in a cable to pull the crate up the ramp with an acceleration of $1.5 \text{ m/s}^2$? (Use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
